msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a treatise on the first Punic War.

msItem.title: De primo bello punico (On the first Punic War)
msItem.author: Bruni, Leonardo, 1369-1444

respStmt.persName: Illuminator, Master of the Vitae Imperatorum, active 1402-1459

msItem.title: De primo bello punico (On the first Punic War)
msItem.incipit: Vereor ne qui putent me antiqua nimium consectari si commentaria primi punici o belli
msItem.explicit: pauca loca excedere iussi sunt. Explic[it] Gallicu[m] Bellu[m] Post Primu[m] Punicu[m] cum Romanis Gestum Descriptum a Leonardo Aretino Viro Doctissimo Fe[lici]t[e]r

supportDesc.extent: iii+78+i; 217 x 148 mm bound to 227 x 158 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; contemporary numbering of quires in ink, lower middle margin verso

p.catchwords: Horizontal lower right corner verso; fols.: 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 72

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; one column of twenty-nine lines; written area: 126 x 75 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: One eight-line decorated initial with full inhabited border; two large illuminated initials; red and blue three-line initials throughout; some marginalia
Inside front coverNotes written in pencil by John Frederick Lewis
Inside front coverPaper attached with the signature of T. F. Richardson and "no. 17"
Insert i rectoEighteenth-century note in Italian
[Flyleaf 1 recto]Signature and stamp of John Frederick Lewis, dated 1919
78v"Leonardus Aretin" written on fol. 78v in a cursive hand. Additional text on the page has been scraped off

binding.p: Original brown calf over wooden boards; stamped with arabesques and emblems of the Paschal lamb; back repaired

history.provenance: Written for Giovanni-Maria Viscount of Sforza, Duke of Milan ?; Trivulzio-Belgioioso-Trotti Collection, Milan, sold (1885) to Hoepli; sale by Leavitt, New York, (1888); Thomas Richardson, Boston; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia (obtained 1919); given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936; notes written in pencil by Lewis on inside of front cover; paper with the signature of T. F. Richardson and "no. 17"; on pasted on to inside front cover; tipped onto the front flyleaf is a hand-ruled page of notes written in Italian in an eighteenth-century hand that describes the manuscript as being made for Giovanni Maria Visconti of Somma; signature and stamp of Lewis on the recto of the first flyleaf, dated 1919; stamp of Richardson on recto of front flyleaf; cutting from a manuscript pasted onto the recto of fol. 78, probably from a prayer book; on fol. 1r the coat of arms of the Sforza family
